title: Junior Pauga
text:
Junior Pauga (born 3 February 1996) is a professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> <a href="footballer">footballer</a> who plays as a for the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>.
Background.
Born in <a href="%C5%8Ct%C4%81huhu">Ōtāhuhu</a>, Auckland, New Zealand, Pauga was a student at <a href="Kelston%20Boys%27%20High%20School">Kelston Boys' High School</a>. In 2014, he was named MVP of the national secondary school tournament and chosen in the NZ Secondary Schools team to play New South Wales.
Career.
2016-20.
Between 2016 and 2018, Pauga was a member of the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a> <a href="NSW%20Cup">NSW Cup</a> team. From 2019, he joined the <a href="Wynnum%20%20Manly%20Seagulls">Wynnum Manly Seagulls</a> in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a>. In his first season, he played 13 games for 10 wins, 3 tries, 9 goals. and was a member of the team that lost to the <a href="Burleigh%20Bears">Burleigh Bears</a> in the grand final.
In 2020, Pauga made one appearance in Wynnum's first grade before the competition was cancelled because of the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a>. One of a handful of players who chose to join the lower-grade team when that competition restarted, Pauga scored a try and kicked 6 goals as Wynnum won the reserve grade grand final. He said, "When COVID hit, we got told that Cup was off; and then I heard that <a href="Brisbane%20Rugby%20League%20%282001%29">BRL</a> was coming back, so I was like... even though Cup was not on, I thought this would be a good opportunity for me to play footy and have fun with the boys. It was pretty good to be part of the team; I have some mates, we all came from New Zealand and the goal was for them to play Cup this year."
After playing the first 4 games with Wynnum in 2021, Pauga was released to join the Wests Tigers in the NRL.
2021.
Pauga made his debut in round 18, for the Wests Tigers against the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a>, scoring a try in a 42-24 victory. Before the game, he said, "It’s been a tough journey over the past three years. After leaving the Warriors, I didn’t have anything and had to go to Queensland to start all over again. When this opportunity came up, I had no doubt in my mind that I was going to take it with both hands and I don’t ever want to take it for granted."
